sen.j: 東本願寺（ひがしほんがんじ Higashi Hongan-ji）は、京都府京都市下京区にある浄土真宗の仏教寺院。
sen.e: Higashi Hongan-ji is a Shin Buddhist temple in Shimokyo Ward, Kyoto.
Higashi Hongan-ji is a Shin Buddhist temple in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 原文に京都府京都市下京区とあるので、 Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto→Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyotoに修正。なお、下京区は、Simogyokuが正しい。
sen.e: Higashi Hongan-ji temple is a Shin Buddhist temple in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 表記は、浄土真宗本願寺派の公式ホームページのものを採用。http://www2.hongwanji.or.jp/english/再チェック

sen.j: 真宗教団連合（真宗十派）の一つ真宗大谷派の本山で、西本願寺（浄土真宗本願寺派の本山〈正式名称・本願寺〉）と並ぶ浄土真宗の本山である。
sen.e: As the main temple of the Otani sect, which is part of the Shinshu Kyodan Rengo (Ten Schools of Shin Buddhism), it joins Nishi Hongan-ji (officially Honganji, main temple of the Honganji sect of Shin Buddhism), as one of the main temples of Shin Buddhism.

It is the head temple of the Otani sect, which is part of the Shinshu Kyodan Rengo (Ten Schools of Shin Buddhism), and also joins Nishi Hongan-ji (officially Hongan-ji, head temple of the Hongan-ji sect of Shin Buddhism), as one of the main temples of Shin Buddhism.
sen.cmt: asが、一つの文章の中で二つあるので修正。 main temple→head temple 本山は一宗の末寺を統括する寺なので、headの方が適当かと思われる。 Honganji→Hongan-jiに2箇所修正（上記と表現を統一する為）。
sen.e: It is the head temple of the Otani sect, which is part of the Shinshu Kyodan Rengo (Ten Schools of Shin Buddhism), and also joins Nishi Hongan-ji temple (officially Hongan-ji temple, head temple of the Hongan-ji sect of Shin Buddhism), as one of the main temples of Shin Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 西本願寺関係の用語は以下の同宗派の公式ホームページを参考にしたhttp://www2.hongwanji.or.jp/english/再チェック

sen.j: 正式の寺号は1987年までは「本願寺」、同年以降は「真宗本廟（しんしゅうほんびょう）」。
sen.e: The official name of the temple was "Hongan-ji" until 1987, since which time it has been "Shinshu Honbyo".
The official name of the temple was "Hongan-ji" until 1987, since which time it has been "Shinshu Honbyo".
The official name of the temple was "Hongan-ji" until 1987, since which time it has been "Shinshu Honbyo Temple".
sen.cmt: 裏づけとれず再チェック

sen.j: 同じ下京区にある西本願寺と区別するため、「お東さん」と呼ばれることが多い。
sen.e: To distinguish it from Nishi Hongan-ji, also in Shimokyo Ward, it is often called "O-Higashi-san".
To distinguish it from Nishi Hongan-ji, also in Shimogyo Ward, it is often called "O-Higashi-san".
To distinguish it from Nishi Hongan-ji temple, also in Shimogyo Ward, it is often called "O-Higashi-san".

sen.j: （東西に分裂以前の歴史の詳細は本願寺の歴史の項目を参照）
sen.e: (For history before the east-west split, refer to the article on The History of Hongan-ji.)
(For history before the east-west split, refer to the article on The History of Hongan-ji.)
(For history before the east-west split, refer to the article on The History of Hongan-ji Temple.)

sen.j: 本願寺の第12代教如（光寿）が、徳川家康によって本願寺の東に寺領を与えられ、1602年に本願寺が二つに分かれたとき、教如が開いた。
sen.e: Kyounyo (Kouju), the 12th master of Hongan-ji, was given an allotment for a temple to the east of Hongan-ji by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and founded Higashi Hongan-ji when Hongan-ji split in 1602.
Kyounyo (Kouju), the 12th master of Hongan-ji, was given a domain for a temple to the east of Hongan-ji by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and founded Higashi Hongan-ji when Hongan-ji split in 1602.
sen.cmt: 寺領とは、寺院の所有する土地の事なので、allotment→domain の方が適当かと思われる。
sen.e: Kyounyo (Kouju), the 12th master of Hongan-ji Temple, was given a domain for a temple to the east of Hongan-ji by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and founded Higashi Hongan-ji Temple when Hongan-ji Temple split in 1602.

sen.j: 現在の京都市下京区烏丸七条に位置し、堀川七条に位置する西本願寺の東にあるため、東本願寺と称されるようになった。
sen.e: Located in present day Karasuma Shichijo, Shimokyo Ward, Kyoto, it is called Higashi (Eastern) Hongan-ji because it is to the east of Nishi (Western) Hongan-ji, which is located at Horikawa Shichijo.
Located in present day Karasuma Shichijo, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto, it is called Higashi (Eastern) Hongan-ji because it is to the east of Nishi (Western) Hongan-ji, which is located at Horikawa Shichijo.

Located in present day Karasuma Shichijo, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto, it is called Higashi Temple (Eastern) Hongan-ji Temple because it is to the east of Nishi (Western) Hongan-ji Temple, which is located at Horikawa Shichijo.

sen.j: 1987年には、大谷派と包括・被包括の関係にあった宗教法人としての本願寺が法的に解散され、宗派と一体のものとされた。
sen.e: It was a religious corporation overseen by the Otani sect until 1987, at which time Hongan-ji was legally dissolved and absorbed by the sect.
It was a religious corporation overseen by the Otani sect until 1987, at which time Hongan-ji was legally dissolved and absorbed by the sect.
It was a religious corporation overseen by the Otani sect until 1987, at which time Hongan-ji Temple was legally dissolved and absorbed by the sect.

sen.j: 以後、東本願寺の正式名称は「真宗本廟」（「本廟」とは、同信同行の門信徒が宗祖親鸞の教えを聞信する根本道場・帰依処としての、親鸞の「はかどころ」の意）となる。
sen.e: After that, Higashi Hongan-ji's official name became "Shin-shu Honbyo" ("Honbyo" means the original sanctuary where followers hear the teaching of the patriarch Shinran, the resting place of Shinran).
After that, Higashi Hongan-ji's official name became "Shinshu Honbyo" ("Honbyo" means the original sanctuary where followers hear the teaching of the patriarch Shinran, the resting place of Shinran).
sen.cmt: Shin-shu→Shinshu 上記の表現と統一する為に修正。
sen.e: After that, Higashi Hongan-ji Temple's official name became "Shinshu Honbyo Temple" ("Honbyo" means the original sanctuary where followers hear the teaching of the patriarch Shinran, the resting place of Shinran).

sen.j: 分派した浄土真宗東本願寺派と区別を付け、正当性を主張する意味もある。
sen.e: It is also to distinguish it from the breakaway Higashi Hongan-ji sect of Shin Buddhism and emphasize its propriety.
It is also to distinguish it from the breakaway Higashi Hongan-ji sect of Shin Buddhism and emphasize its propriety.
It is also to distinguish it from the breakaway Higashi Hongan-ji sect of Shin Buddhism and emphasize its propriety.

sen.j: ⇒お東騒動
sen.e: cf O-Higashi Rebellion
cf O-Higashi Rebellion
cf O-Higashi Rebellion

sen.j: 江戸時代に4度の火災に遭っており、その火災の多さから「火出し本願寺」とのあだ名もあるほどで、現存建造物の多くはどんどん焼けの後、明治時代期の再建だが、建築・障壁画等は当時の技術の粋を集める。
sen.e: Having had 4 fires in the Edo period, so many that it acquired the nickname, "Flaming Hongan-ji", the current buildings, though many burned and were rebuilt in the Meiji period, maintain the style of the time in their construction and the paintings on the walls.

Having had 4 fires in the Edo period, so many that it acquired the nickname, "Flaming Hongan-ji", the current buildings, though many burned and were rebuilt in the Meiji period, maintain the style of the time in their construction and the paintings on the walls.

Having had 4 fires in the Edo period, so many that it acquired the nickname, "Flaming Hongan-ji Temple", the current buildings, though many burned and were rebuilt in the Meiji period, maintain the style of the time in their construction and the paintings on the walls.

sen.j: 親鸞聖人像を安置する御影堂は世界最大級の木造建築物である（現在保護屋根に覆われ大修復工事中）。
sen.e: The Goei-do, which houses the statue of Shinran Shonin, is among the largest wooden buildings in the world (currently covered by scaffolding for a major restoration).
sen.cmt: 御影堂はFounder's Hallという説明がつけられていることが多い。
sen.e: The Goei-do, which houses the statue of Shinran Shonin, is among the largest wooden buildings in the world (currently covered by scaffolding for a major restoration).
The Goei-do, which houses the statue of Shinran Shonin, is among the largest wooden buildings in the world (currently covered by scaffolding for a major restoration).

sen.j: また、御影堂門は三門三大門の一つである。
sen.e: The Goei-do Gate is also one of the three famous gates of Kyoto.
The Goei-do Gate is also one of the three famous gates of Kyoto.
The Goei-do Gate is also one of the three famous gates of Kyoto.

sen.j: 親鸞真蹟の『顕浄土真実教行証文類（国宝）』（坂東本）を所蔵。
sen.e: It is home to Shinran's "Kyogyo Shinsho" (National Treasure) (Bando Edition).
sen.cmt: 顕浄土真実教行証文類は教行信証とも言う。Wikipediaの英語ページでも略称が用いられている。http://www.geocities.co.jp/HeartLand-Himawari/4022/monto/yougo.htmlhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyogyoshinsho
sen.e: Shinran's "Kyogyo Shinsho" (National Treasure) (Bando Edition) is in its possession.
Shinran's "Kyogyo Shinsho" (National Treasure) (Bando Edition) is in its possession.

sen.j: 近接する飛地境内地の渉成園は国の名勝。
sen.e: Shosei-en Garden, on the neighboring grounds, is a national scenic area.
sen.cmt: 飛地境内地とは境内の一部とされているが、寺とは離れたところにある土地
sen.e: Shosei-en Garden, on the neighboring grounds, is a national scenic area.
Shosei-en Garden, on the neighboring grounds, is a national scenic area.

sen.j: 現門首は大谷暢顕（浄如）。
sen.e: The current master of the temple is Choken OTANI (Jonyo).
The current master of the temple is Choken OTANI (Jonyo).
The current master of the temple is Choken OTANI (Jonyo).

sen.j: 国宝
sen.e: National Treasures
National Treasures
National Treasures

tit.j: 絹本著色親鸞聖人像（安城御影）
tit.cmt: 京都国立博物館の以下のホームページを参照。http://www.kyohaku.go.jp/eng/tenji/chinretsu/kyoukou/kyoukou.html絹本著色の部分がないが、上記のページにはほかの作品について、かっこ書きで(color on silk)とある。

tit.cmt: 作品名と弘願本、表記確認できず

Hongan-ji Shonin - Shinran Picture Book (Kogan Edition) 4 Volumes

tit.j: 紙本著色本願寺聖人伝 絵康楽寺円寂、宗舜筆 4巻
tit.e: Hongan-ji Shonin-den Enjaku KORAKUJI, Soushun 4 Volumes
tit.cmt: 「本願寺聖人伝 絵康楽寺円寂、宗舜筆」と書かれているが、「本願寺聖人伝絵 康楽寺円寂、宗舜筆」の誤りであると思われる。本願寺聖人伝絵は英語表記は不明だが、ほんがんじしょうにんでんねと読む。以下のページでは｢詞書（ことばがき）は、覚如筆。絵は、上2巻は康楽寺円寂、下2巻は、康楽寺宗舜による筆」となっている。http://jiten.biglobe.ne.jp/j/3d/47/28/e5937422c0c8654d4164d1d400d69b30.htm
tit.e: Hongan-ji Shonin-den Enjaku KORAKUJI, Soushun 4 Volumes
